description.narrative: By 2016, EducamazÃ´nia is consolidated as a regional initiative to promote the right to learn, involving state and local leaders, social organizations, universities, and has an approved, implemented and monitored work plan., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, each and every child aged 4 to 17 exercising their constitutional right to basic education municipalities and state public schools network achieved or surpassed quality official index (IDEB 2015) goals teachers and municipal education and school managers have their capacities developed for quality education basic education drop out and retention rates of most disadvantaged boys and girls decrease in the Amazon, Semiarid and in the 174 municipalities with more than 150 thousand inhabitants, especially among indigenous, quilombola, riparian, afro-Brazilians children and adolescents, those with disabilities, and also the most vulnerable to emergencies and disaster risks.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, Educamazonia is consolidated as a regional initiative to promote the right to learn, involving state and local leaders,social organizations, universities, and has an approved, implemented and monitored work plan.

description.narrative: More than 200 municipalities from the nine states of the Amazon region actively implemented special actions such as trainings, social mobilization, participative planning to fulfill children and adolescents' right to education. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: % Of states with representatives from government, academia and civil society, participating in meetings and virtual environments of Educamazonia.

baseline.value: : Situation in 2011: a meeting in 2011, with significant participation of representatives of government, academia and civil society.

title.narrative: Degree of implementation of the Educamazonia Work Plan.

baseline.value: Situation in 2012 (First work plan prepared in 2011, with implementation beginning in 2012).
